46.00.text: This model of the Liebherr LB 28

48.55.text:
drilling rig comes in a particularly
large Liebherr branded box.

52.83.text:
When you open it up the first thing you
find in addition to the trays

58.09.text:
It covers the main assembly points for
the model and is printed in German,

61.85.text: and on the other side it's in English.

64.74.text:
So we're off to a good start with some
instructions, let's look at what's in the

68.47.text:
Firstly there are a couple of items in
the top tray, and this is a piece of

74.13.text:
and if we cut the tape and lift the lid
there is also a large piece of plastic.

79.39.text:
Its textured and in fact is a display
base for the model

82.40.text:
and we'll see how that gets used a
little bit later on.

86.70.text: On with the rest of the box and there is some tape to cut and we can take the lid

90.80.text:
and then it becomes obvious why the
model box is so large.   There are various

96.92.text:
and that includes this rubber band on
the crawler tracks and after that there is many

100.86.text:
wrappings of a cling film type
material.

109.10.text:
The first thing we will do is tidy up some
poor finishing work on the auxiliary

114.73.text:
and we will re-fix it and trim it up so it hangs
better.

118.16.text:
To start the assembly proper we will add the
rotary drive onto the leader

123.63.text:
and initially it hangs in place and then
you secure it with some screws.

128.38.text:
There are two small screws to insert, one
on either side,

131.97.text:
and depending on how tightly you do them
up they lock the sledge to the leader.

136.87.text:
With the Kelly bar fixed we need to attach
the hoist rope to the end.

141.21.text:
You have to feed it through a very small
hole

144.46.text:
and in fact this turns out to be quite
frustrating.

147.02.text:
So without showing you how frustrating
it is we will move straight onto the

150.35.text:
rope being fixed and a good tip to
secure a knot

153.45.text:
is to add a touch of our old friend super
glue.

156.86.text: The next job is to attach some hydraulic lines from the rotary drive to the

161.12.text:
Again this is fiddly and a bit
frustrating so let's jump straight to

166.71.text:
The last bit of assembly is to fit a very
small flood light to the cab

170.09.text:
and again this is fiddly and frustrating
so we jump straight to the finished

175.36.text:
One unusual aspect of this model is that
it comes with a ready formed display base

179.72.text:
and to use it you push out the preformed
hole where a pile will go,

184.23.text:
and then we add in the short length of
pile casing.

187.73.text:
Once that is put in there is a small adaptor piece
that goes in at the end,

191.02.text:
and it has got different diameters at each end so you
have to fit it the right way around,

195.43.text:
and after that you can then drop in the
LB 28.

198.99.text: The final touch is to lower the casing drive onto the casing.

212.07.text:
The tracks are metal and  detailed and
they are mounted on flames which have

217.40.text:
The cab is also detailed wit.h a protection
guard on the roof

221.27.text:
The body has got some solid grilles in
the casting and this model is in the

226.31.text:
Grundbau of Germany and the colour scheme
and graphics are rendered well.

230.37.text:
There are plenty of rubber hydraulic hoses
running to the winches

234.30.text:
and that detailing continues around the
rotary drive.

238.20.text:
The leader is metal and at the top
the pulleys are also metal.

242.98.text:
Although the metal kelly bar is not telescopic
the auger looks very good

246.46.text:
but it is permanently fixed to the kelly bar and 
not removable.

250.40.text:
At this point let's run a quick check
on how tall the model is..

253.65.text:
...and it is about 19 inches or 48
centimetres.

263.40.text: Here we are out on the Cranes Etc piling site

266.32.text:
and the tracks are too stiff to roll on a
smooth surface.

270.18.text:
You can turn them by hand although again
they are quite stiff

274.33.text:
and they are held with a fairly strong tension
by the spring loaded idler.

279.56.text:
With the leader raised off the ground you can
rotate the model smoothly

283.94.text:
and there is also some good functionality on
the piling equipment itself.

288.07.text:
The main winch can be operated to raise
and lower the auger

291.69.text:
and it's got a spring-loaded brake so it
will hold a position,

296.11.text:
and if you loosen the screws that secure
the sledge to the leader

300.03.text:
the whole rotary platform can go up and
down and that includes the casing driver.

305.34.text:
So the whole arrangement can then be
raised and lowered down onto the casing.

310.53.text:
Also working on the model is the auxiliary
winch although the hook is very lightweight

314.61.text: so here we've added some chains.

317.37.text:
Another thing you can do if you're so
inclined is to rotate the auger.

320.68.text:
Yes this is good for anyone who likes
screwing with a model.

324.64.text:
The other main feature of the model is that
all of the hydraulics that control the

329.52.text:
so it's possible to lower the leader
completely in order to form

334.98.text:
The hydraulic rams are reasonably stiff and
will hold most positions that you set,

340.56.text:
and another nice aspect is that you can
remove two pins from the leader head.

345.90.text:
It allows the head to rotate downwards
to lower the transport headroom.

351.06.text:
The last stage of preparing the model
for transport is to reduce the width of

355.71.text:
They are telescopic so you can reduce them from a
working width

361.43.text:
All you need after that is a reasonably
large transport vehicle

365.45.text:
and then you've got a very impressive
display combination.

368.41.text:
Another possibility is to combine the LB
28 with other models to form a piling

397.55.text: This is a very good piling model from NZG and it looks very good in

402.90.text:
It is a limited edition of
only 300 models and the colour

406.75.text: scheme and graphics are very good,

408.44.text:
and the functionality and flexibility of
the model also sets it apart.

412.79.text:
So if you like piling equipment this
model is easy to highly recommend.
